thread.title_full: The world’s hottest city where temperatures reach 54C and birds fall out of the sky - UK news - NewsLocker

title: The world’s hottest city where temperatures reach 54C and birds fall out of the sky - UK news - NewsLocker
text: Severe dust storms make the heat feel worse (Picture: Yasser Al-Zayyat / AFP)Remember the unbearable heat in the UK where record-breaking temperatures reached 40C? While spring has finally arrived in the UK, and we’re looking forward to the warmth of the sun, there is such a thing as too hot. In one country in particular, there’s a city so hot that birds can be seen falling dead from the sky, and there’s even air conditioning outside in the streets.Kuwait City in the Middle Eas [✗ Close
